trans-unit.source: View SAML Returned by the Access Control Service (Java)
trans-unit.target: View SAML Returned by the Access Control Service (Java)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to view SAML returned by the Access Control Service in Java applications hosted on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to view SAML returned by the Access Control Service in Java applications hosted on Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to view SAML returned by the Azure Access Control Service
trans-unit.target: How to view SAML returned by the Azure Access Control Service

trans-unit.source: This guide will show you how to view the underlying Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) returned to your application by the Azure Access Control Service (ACS).
trans-unit.target: This guide will show you how to view the underlying Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) returned to your application by the Azure Access Control Service (ACS).

trans-unit.source: The guide builds on the [How to Authenticate Web Users with Azure Access Control Service Using Eclipse][] topic, by providing code that displays the SAML information.
trans-unit.target: The guide builds on the [How to Authenticate Web Users with Azure Access Control Service Using Eclipse][] topic, by providing code that displays the SAML information.

trans-unit.source: The completed application will look similar to the following.
trans-unit.target: The completed application will look similar to the following.

trans-unit.source: Example SAML output
trans-unit.target: Example SAML output

trans-unit.source: For more information on ACS, see the [Next steps](#next_steps) section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on ACS, see the [Next steps](#next_steps) section.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Access Services Control Filter (by Microsoft Open Technologies) is a community technology preview.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Access Services Control Filter (by Microsoft Open Technologies) is a community technology preview.

trans-unit.source: As pre-release software, it is not formally supported by Microsoft Open Technologies, Inc. nor Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: As pre-release software, it is not formally supported by Microsoft Open Technologies, Inc. nor Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete the tasks in this guide, complete the sample at [How to Authenticate Web Users with Azure Access Control Service Using Eclipse][] and use it as the starting point for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: To complete the tasks in this guide, complete the sample at [How to Authenticate Web Users with Azure Access Control Service Using Eclipse][] and use it as the starting point for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Add the JspWriter library to your build path and deployment assembly
trans-unit.target: Add the JspWriter library to your build path and deployment assembly

trans-unit.source: Add the library that contains the **javax.servlet.jsp.JspWriter** class to your build path and deployment assembly.
trans-unit.target: Add the library that contains the **javax.servlet.jsp.JspWriter** class to your build path and deployment assembly.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Tomcat, the library is **jsp-api.jar**, which is located in the Apache **lib** folder.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Tomcat, the library is **jsp-api.jar**, which is located in the Apache **lib** folder.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse's Project Explorer, right-click **MyACSHelloWorld**, click **Build Path**, click **Configure Build Path**, click the **Libraries** tab, and then click **Add External JARs**.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse's Project Explorer, right-click **MyACSHelloWorld**, click **Build Path**, click **Configure Build Path**, click the **Libraries** tab, and then click **Add External JARs**.

trans-unit.source: In the **JAR Selection** dialog, navigate to the necessary JAR, select it, and then click **Open**.
trans-unit.target: In the **JAR Selection** dialog, navigate to the necessary JAR, select it, and then click **Open**.

trans-unit.source: With the **Properties for MyACSHelloWorld** dialog still open, click **Deployment Assembly**.
trans-unit.target: With the **Properties for MyACSHelloWorld** dialog still open, click **Deployment Assembly**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Web Deployment Assembly** dialog, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Web Deployment Assembly** dialog, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Assembly Directive** dialog, click **Java Build Path Entries** and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Assembly Directive** dialog, click **Java Build Path Entries** and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate library and click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate library and click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the **Properties for MyACSHelloWorld** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the **Properties for MyACSHelloWorld** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Modify the JSP file to display SAML
trans-unit.target: Modify the JSP file to display SAML

trans-unit.source: Modify **index.jsp** to use the following code.
trans-unit.target: Modify **index.jsp** to use the following code.

trans-unit.source: Run the application
trans-unit.target: Run the application

trans-unit.source: Run your application in the computer emulator or deploy to Azure, using the steps documented at [How to Authenticate Web Users with Azure Access Control Service Using Eclipse][].
trans-unit.target: Run your application in the computer emulator or deploy to Azure, using the steps documented at [How to Authenticate Web Users with Azure Access Control Service Using Eclipse][].

trans-unit.source: Launch a browser and open your web application.
trans-unit.target: Launch a browser and open your web application.

trans-unit.source: After you log on to your application, you'll see SAML information, including the security assertion provided by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: After you log on to your application, you'll see SAML information, including the security assertion provided by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: To further explore ACS's functionality and to experiment with more sophisticated scenarios, see [Access Control Service 2.0][].
trans-unit.target: To further explore ACS's functionality and to experiment with more sophisticated scenarios, see [Access Control Service 2.0][].

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
